intro: Alsine tenuifolia, commonly known as slender sandwort, is a low-growing annual herb native to arid and semi-arid regions. It features small, grass-like leaves that are typically less than 1 centimeter in length, arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Its botanical structure is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
